intro: Atriplex spinibractea, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, spiny leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and coastal dunes. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is well adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Atriplex spinibractea plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
